page.title: 08SW Hamilton - Local Politics
page.content: {DISTRICT COUNCIL ELECTIONS} The area surveyed is part of Hamilton District Council. It comprised of 4 wards with a total electorate of just over 16000. The turn out at the last elections (May 1984) was about 45% on average and all 4 seats were won by Labour candidates who got about 83% of the poll in 3 seats, but in the ward which is mostly owner-occupied and largely out of our area, only 38%. The Council has 17 Labour council- lors, 1 Conservative and 2 Alliance. The other feature of this election was the performance of the Alliance cand- idates. {HAMILTON CONSTITUENCY} The electorate is 61,430 and the seat occupied by Labour with 52% of the votes, cast by a 4 cornered fight. During the 1960's, this seat was won by the SNP in a bye-election.
